snippet: Officials said the strikes had targeted fighters of the Kurdistan Workers’ Party and were in retaliation for an attack against a military base.
abstract: Turkish warplanes strike positions of the Kurdistan Workers' Party in country's southeastern region; attacks, first in nearly two years, come in retaliation for PKK's attack on a military outpost; move becomes a flash point for international criticism of Turkey's unwillingness to take on a bigger role in fighting Islamic State militants.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and SEBNEM ARSU
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Suruc, Turkey; Eric Schmitt from Washington; and an employee of The New York Times from Raqqa, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Officials said the strikes had targeted fighters of the Kurdistan Workers’ Party and were in retaliation for an attack against a military base.

headline.main: Turkish Airstrike Hits Kurds, Complicating Fight Against Islamic State
headline.print_headline: Turkish Airstrike Hits Kurds, Complicating Fight Against Islamic State

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
